Simple install Git on Leopard by Elad Meidar

24 Oct 2008

&lt;br /&gt;mkdir -p ~/Downloads/src&lt;br /&gt;cd ~/Downloads/src&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;# Set options since we don't have GNU gettext installed&lt;br /&gt;export TCL_PATH=`which tclsh`&lt;br /&gt;export NO_MSGFMT=1&lt;br /&gt;export GIT_VERSION='1.6.0.2'&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;# Get and install git&lt;br /&gt;curl -O "http://kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/git-$GIT_VERSION.tar.bz2"&lt;br /&gt;tar xjvf "git-$GIT_VERSION.tar.bz2"&lt;br /&gt;cd "git-$GIT_VERSION/"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;# When on Mac OS X&lt;br /&gt;./configure&lt;br /&gt;make&lt;br /&gt;sudo make install&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;cd ..&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;# Install Man Pages&lt;br /&gt;curl -O "http://kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/git-manpages-$GIT_VERSION.tar.bz2"&lt;br /&gt;sudo tar xjv -C /usr/local/share/man -f "git-manpages-$GIT_VERSION.tar.bz2"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;
